questions.prompt: Create a user object with name "Max" and age 34 using object literal syntax. (Type the object literal only.)
questions.explanation: Objects group related values as key:value pairs.

questions.prompt: Using dot notation, how do you access the name property of user? (Type the expression only.)
questions.explanation: Dot notation accesses properties on an object.

questions.prompt: Add a method greet to the user object that logs "Hi I'm " + this.name. (Type only the method definition as it appears inside an object.)
questions.explanation: Methods are functions stored as object properties and can use this to reference the object.

questions.prompt: Inside a method, how do you access the age property with this? (Type the expression only.)
questions.explanation: this refers to the current object inside its method.
questions.codeSnippet:
const user = { name: "Max", age: 34, showAge() { console.log(this.age); } };
user.showAge();
